'Queen Elvis' is an album released by Robyn Hitchcock and The Egyptians on A&M
Records in 1989.

Having signed to A&M in 1988, this second set for the label was unreleased in
Hitchcock's home country the UK. The album's cover depicts Hitchcock in a red
telephone box, illuminated from the inside. Tracks 11 and 12 below are remixes
of 2 album tracks ("Veins of the Queen" and "Freeze"), and were included on the
original A&M U.S. CD Release.
